name: Albany Chef's Food & Wine Festival
description: A three-day festival celebrating Albany's innovative cuisine, featuring local chefs and restaurants with a focus on sustainable agriculture and support for the arts community.

name: Taco Tuesday Showcase
description: Weekly Taco Tuesday event featuring a variety of tacos with unique fusions, hosted by a local favorite known for its vibrant atmosphere.

name: Live Music Night at The Hollow Bar + Kitchen
venue: The Hollow Bar + Kitchen, 79 N Pearl St, Albany, NY
description: An evening of live music featuring local bands with a mix of genres, paired with craft cocktails and a diverse menu at this well-loved spot.

name: Taco & Tequila Night
venue: Toro Cantina, 111 Wolf Rd, Albany, NY
description: A special evening dedicated to tacos and tequila pairings, showcasing authentic flavors and creative twists at a popular local spot.

name: Albany Jazz Festival
venue: Jennings Landing, 1 Quay St, Albany, NY
description: An annual outdoor jazz festival featuring regional and national artists, set along the Hudson River with food vendors offering diverse bites.

name: Fusion Feast at Iron Gate Cafe
venue: Iron Gate Cafe, 182 Washington Ave, Albany, NY
description: A special menu night featuring unique fusion dishes blending global flavors, hosted by a long-established cafe known for its creative approach.

name: Community Block Party
venue: Palace Theatre Albany, 19 Clinton Ave, Albany, NY 12207
description: A free family-friendly event featuring fun activities and community engagement in Downtown Albany. Perfect for all ages to enjoy a vibrant day out.

name: The Little Mermaid - Free Movie
venue: Palace Theatre Albany, 19 Clinton Ave, Albany, NY 12207
description: Part of the Summer in the City series, enjoy a free screening of Disney's The Little Mermaid. Doors open at noon for family activities, movie starts at 1:00 PM.

name: Mendelssohn Club of Albany Holiday Concert
venue: The Egg, Empire State Plaza, Albany, NY 12220
description: The longest continuously performing arts group in the Capital District since 1909, the Mendelssohn Club presents a holiday concert featuring a diverse male chorus from the region.
